member.summary: The video camera configuration.

member.summary: The video capture device.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Describes how to configure the media capture device.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The pipeline to add the component to.
Width of output image in pixels.

Should we create an audio capture device.

member.summary: Gets the emitter for the audio stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaCapture.Out
member.summary: Gets the output stream of images.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaCapture.GetDeviceInfo
member.summary: Returns information about each property exposed by the media capture device.
member.returns: MediaCaptureInfo object defining ranges and availability of each property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaCapture.GetDeviceConfiguration
member.summary: Returns the current configuration for the media capture device.
member.returns: A new MediaCaptureConfiguration object with the device's current settings.

member.summary: Assigns the specified configuration to the media capture device.
member.param: Configuration to set on media capture device.

member.summary: Dispose method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaCapture.AppendSupportedCaptureFormats(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Appends the list of supported capture formats for all devices. Used to build a more informative exception message when the requested capture format is not found.
member.param: The object to which to append the list.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the current contrast.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource
member.summary: Component that streams video and audio from a media file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource.lastPostedImageTime
member.summary: Keep track of the timestamp of the last image frame (computed from the value reported to us by media foundation).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource.lastPostedAudioTime
member.summary: Keep track of the timestamp of the last audio buffer (computed from the value reported to us by media foundation).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource.dropOutOfOrderPackets
member.summary: Whether to drop out of order packets from media foundation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource.#ctor(Microsoft.Psi.Pipeline,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The pipeline to add the component to.
Name of media file to play.
Optional flag specifying whether to drop out of order packets (defaults to false).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Psi.Media.MediaSource.#ctor(Microsoft.Psi.Pipeline,System.IO.Stream,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The pipeline to add the component to.
Source stream of the media to consume.
Optional date/time that the media started.
Optional flag specifying whether to drop out of order packets (defaults to false).

member.summary: Gets the emitter that generates audio from the media.

member.summary: GenerateNext is called by the Generator base class when the next sample should be read.
member.param: The originating time that triggered the current call.
member.returns: The originating time at which to capture the next sample.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the image format expected for input images.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the output frame rate's numerator.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the output frame rate's denominator.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the output bitrate.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the number of bits per audio sample (typically 16).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Psi.Media.Mpeg4WriterConfiguration.AudioSamplesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the number of audio samples per second.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Psi.Media.Mpeg4WriterConfiguration.AudioChannels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines number of audio channels in the output file (should be set to 1 or 2).

member.summary: Gets or sets the native MP4Writer's configuration object.
